wikipedia_page.main:
Leonard Francis "Frank" Newton (Quarter 3 1882 – 27 February 1959) was a footballer who played as a centre forward. He played for five different teams in the Football League.
Newton was the brother of Frederick Newton who kept goal occasionally for Chesterfield and played cricket for Derbyshire.

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford (Park Avenue) A.F.C. seasons

List of Bradford City A.F.C. players (1–49 league appearances)

response: Newton's elder brother known as Frank Newton played centre forward for Chesterfield  FC on 98 occasions, and scored 23 goals from 1902 to 1905. He played for four other clubs and also played internationally for Wales.
* Leo Newton (1888–1939), full name Leonard Frank Newton, Welsh international footballer
* Frank Newton (racing driver), British racing driver and engineer

Leonard Frank Newton (January or February 1888 – 7 February 1939), commonly known as Len or Leo Newton, was a Welsh footballer who played as a centre-forward or half-back and made one appearance for the Wales national team.
